intro: Capsella aestivalis, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Capsella aestivalis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
